reasoning: Aggregate BOTEC estimate summing major neurodegenerative conditions: Parkinson's disease (~17 per 100k), Alzheimer's disease (~25 per 100k), ALS (~2.5 per 100k), Multiple Sclerosis (~5 per 100k), Huntington's disease (~0.8 per 100k), Spinal muscular atrophy (~1 per 100k), Progressive supranuclear palsy (~0.5 per 100k), Lewy body dementia (~10 per 100k), and other rare neurodegenerative conditions (~33 per 100k). Total ~95 per 100k. Low confidence due to significant heterogeneity and overlap between categories.
